greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors of n that are perfect powers.
comment: a(n)=1 iff n is squarefree: a(A005117(n))=1, a(A013929(n))>1;
a(p^k)=k for p prime, k>0: a(A000961(n))=A025474(n);
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Perfect Power
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Divisor Function
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k=i^j, i>=1, j>=2, excluding duplicates} x^k/(1 - x^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Mar 20 2017
mathematica: ppQ[n_] := GCD @@ Last /@ FactorInteger@ n > 1; ppQ[1] = True; f[n_] := Length@ Select[ Divisors@ n, ppQ]; Array[f, 105] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 12 2012 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = 1+ sumdiv(n, d, ispower(d)>1); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 21 2014
(PARI) a(n)={my(f=factor(n)[,2]); 1 + if(#f, sum(k=2, vecmax(f), moebius(k)*(1 - prod(i=1, #f, 1 + f[i]\k))))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 30 2020
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 15 2003
ext: Wrong formula deleted by _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 29 2020
